Clean Accordion

A minimal, efficient, vanilla JavaScript accordion. Only 4KB total!

Download View Github

Basic Initialization

<div data-accordion-group data-options='{"singleOpen":false}'>

  <div data-accordion>
    <div data-title></div>
    <div data-content>
      <div class="wrapper">
      <p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. Sint assumenda ipsam, earum cumque accusamus amet consectetur nam alias, voluptatibus vitae eveniet rem beatae sed repudiandae asperiores! Inventore aliquam maiores a!</p>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>

  <div data-accordion>
    <div data-title></div>
    <div data-content>
      <div class="wrapper">
      <p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. Sint assumenda ipsam, earum cumque accusamus amet consectetur nam alias, voluptatibus vitae eveniet rem beatae sed repudiandae asperiores! Inventore aliquam maiores a!</p>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>

</div>

const elements = document.querySelectorAll('[data-accordion-group]');

const cleanAccordion = new CleanAccordion(elements)

Options

Default Options

{
  singleOpen: true,
  beforeOpen: function() {},
  afterOpen: function() {},
  beforeClose: function() {},
  afterClose: function() {}
}

Passing Options

Override the default options by passing in your own.

const elements = document.querySelectorAll('[data-accordion-group]');

const cleanAccordion = new CleanAccordion(elements, {
  singleOpen: true,
})

Data Options

If you prefer to pass options through HTML use the data-options attribute by passing a valid json object. 
<div data-accordion-group data-options='{"singleOpen":false}'>
...
</div>
